answerText: Walden[10] Thoreau also wrote this work after his brother died from tetanus. It is a travelogue about a boat trip through the Northeast.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 2 | 18 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The author of this work observes that "the masses of men lead lives of quiet desperation." For 10 points each: [10] Name the location in the woods of Concord to which the author moved because he "wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life."
